name: places/ChIJ9emFVf1YwokRRg7Da6twO2s
formattedAddress: 212 E 47th St, New York, NY 10017, USA
adrFormatAddress: 212 E 47th St, New York, NY 10017-2128, USA

originalText.text:
This review is firmly from the perspective of a renter. Do note that most reviews are from owners who do not want their apartment value 'devalued'

First let me start with the positives: The staff are wonderful and helpful with all requests and the building manager is pretty knowledgeable and efficient. The rooftop is nice and gym was 24 hours.

Now for the reality. This building is old and very poorly built. The walls are so paper thin that you will hear your neighbors from everywhere. Up down, left right, even across the hallway.  Even within your apartment if you drop something in the kitchen the person sleeping in the bedroom can wake up.

The floors are sagging and there are massive gaps where the floor meets the wall. You will hear every footstep of your neighbor upstairs.

The neighborhood is relatively drab and dull and almost no community feeling here. There are an increasing number of homeless groups at night now hanging around the block. Some of the most overpriced and terrible restaurants and bars in this area compared to the rest of the city.

This building was converted to a condo in 2007 but most of the fixtures and appliances have not been changed since then. So if moving in make sure you check when they were replaced and try to get them replaced before you move in. Older appliances guzzle electricity and my bills have been double compared to other places I have lived.
